"...So Halpha is just an experiment...": "And we're the test subjects."
"A fabricated world..."

"What could drive someone
to do something like that?!"
"To prepare for a future enemy."
"To fight the Starless."
"They're called Starless, aren't they?"

"There's that word again.
What the hell are these Starless anyways?!"

"Apparently, they're a threat to all mankind.
Said to have killed 700 billion people 500 years ago..."
"500 years? 700 billion? And you believe that?"

"At the very least, I doubt he would have
spent hundreds of years entirely on a whim."

"Right. I want to have a constructive discussion
about this under the assumption it's all true."
"Going on that, let's start with how much of a threat these Starless pose to us."
"Have any of you encountered the Starless?"
"We only saw them on a monitor."
"We haven't actually fought them, no."

"Right. All of a sudden, a huge number of them appeared,
and then Zephetto went to confront them..."
"As for what happened afterwards... we don't know."

"If Zephetto created the DOLLS
as a means of strengthening the ARKS..."

"...then we should assume that they
pose an even greater threat than Dark Falz..."

"That being said, we don't know
when exactly the Starless will attack."

"It could be tomorrow. It could be
several hundred years from now."
"...There are too many unknowns here."

"If so, we should first tackle
the immediate problem in front of us."
"...The DOLLS."
"They're still active in all regions."
"They're still being manufactured?"
"The same as ever, in a way."
"I'm afraid so."

"Oh, I know. Maybe Leciel has some
clues about how to stop them...?"

"Right. At around the same time you three made your escape,
the Resurgent ARKS aboard Leciel also fled the structure."

"According to some of their testimony, there exists a device
to control the DOLLS somewhere in Leciel's central region."
"Well then, what are we waiting for?"

"...The teleporter leading to Leciel's
central region no longer functions."
"What?"
"At present, we're not sure what caused it."

"Perhaps it was damaged in a Starless attack,
or perhaps Zephetto did something to it beforehand..."
"...Damn it all!"
"Nothing's changing... Nothing CAN change..."

"...So, what? This was all for nothing?
Everything we've done so far was just meaningless...?"
"That's not true at all."
"This isn't like you, Guren."
"Well, what else do we have, then?!"

"...We still have... tomorrow, and every day
after that. We're still alive right now."

"Aina has the right of it. There is much that
can yet be done for the sake of our future."

"Ilma. I want you to spare no effort
investigating that teleporter for us."
"You got it."

"There simply must be other avenues open to us.
Methods of travel to Leciel, methods of stopping the DOLLS..."
"Halpha is an experiment after all, right?"
"That's true. The Ryuker Devices, Trinitas..."

"We should now be able to learn
even more about them, don't you think?"

"With the cooperation of
members of Resurgent ARKS, surely."
"What about the DOLLS Manufacturing Facility in Stiaï¼Ÿ"
"Can't we at least shut that place down?"

"We'll be looking into that place again as well. If push comes to shove,
we may have to take the risk and simply destroy the place."

"Oh, because if we destroyed it, we'd essentially
be cutting off one of Halpha's lifelines?"

"Yeah... Its energy plant is wholly
integrated throughout all of Halpha."

"It pisses me off,
but it's all very well made..."

"And there's no guarantee that shutting down
our lifeline would stop the manufacturing of DOLLS."
"Would Zephetto have thought that far?"
"Maybe Zephetto's experiment isn't over yet?"
"...What an awful man."

"...At any rate, let's each start by
investigating what we can."
"We'll continue our talks after that."

"Next, we have to prepare for new battles.
Let's take measure of each region's capabilities..."
